name: Turnberry, A Luxury Collection Resort, Scotland

reviews.text: We stayed here as a family of four during half term holidays and used my Starwood points at last.
reviews.title: A wonderful, if a little expensive hotel

reviews.text: The room was wonderful although the view was not. There was an enclosed sleeping areas with two beds and a TV for our children which was perfect for some quite time and privacy. Bathroom was spacious clean and well equipped. Comfortable bed too.
reviews.title: An absolutely lovely hotel but a major mistake was not attended properly

reviews.text: Breakfast was superb - kippers, traditional, lean foods, variety, quality and service was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Golf Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner one night was also excellent and we were well attended to by waiters.
reviews.title: Not a 5 Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Afternoon tea was pleasant with excellent views of the gardens, golf course and the waterfront.
reviews.title: Service done right
Very classy place! P.S. from 2nd Swisstraveller: or what you would expect...
reviews.text: I like the attachment to the detail visible in this hotel and its perfect management. We did not find it easy to locate though Turnberry is small. This hotel could be better indicated!

reviews.title: Our second visit
reviews.text: When arriving at the hotel entrance we were asked for valet parking. The suitcases were taken swiftly at the car by kilted bellmen and appeared miraculously in our room. The receptionist informed us that we were upgraded but 15 minutes were needed for "final touches"! We took seats in the “tea room” with a view on the golf course and studied the menus of the various outlets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. from the 2nd Swisstraveller: the key was received after telling the receptionist that we renounce to an upgrade and wish to have the room we booked.
reviews.title: Rather Dissappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eventually, we go the key to our room that was big indeed with a bathroom of the same size: big free standing bath tube, separate cabins for shower and toilet, heated floor, great products (lemon grass?) for shower, hair and body. The room had no view - we had view from the lobby, restaurants and swimming pool compensating for this drawback. The room included cattle, tea, coffee and biscuits selection as well as free Wi-Fi
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: In the evening, we decided for "1906". It was a good choice, we were welcomed in French language (Scotland was allied with France for centuries with number of Queens of French origin). Windows were closed at our request (the rain started), Freshly baked selection of breads (so difficult to spot in Scotland!) appeared immediately. The service was perfect, food very good and the bill in accordance.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel in need of major training and upgrading
Great Views when clear
reviews.text: Beautiful property with stunning views including a 12 hole pitch and putt on the front lawn. Service was excellent. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the lack of central a/c which is a pet peeve of mine even though I know it is not needed 9-10 months out of the year. Luxury property's including pebble beach should have this amenity.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay
reviews.text: Reading some of the Tripadvisor reviews you could wonder if we stayed at the same hotel. Perhaps we were lucky and we did upgrade to a seaview room - but we had a fabulous time and very much enjoyed our stay. Perhaps because the majority of guests are golfers the hotel had a very relaxed atmosphere. All members of staff throughout the hotel, spa and golf course/club house were friendly and courteous. The room was beautiful - great bed, fantastic view and plenty of space. While we didn't have any treatments in the Spa it seemed well appointed with a good pool and lounge areas. We had dinner in the Ailsa lounge which was more relaxed than the fine dining restaurant but very good. Breakfast was great and lunch in the club house lounge was very well done. If I had to point out any niggles that might bother some fusspots some of the paintwork in our room and along the corridors was a bit scuffed/grubby but the overall experience was so good and staff so helpful and friendly this didn't matter one bit. It is quite expensive but for treat I would heartily recommend it to anyone - golfer or not.

reviews.title: A Must if You're in Scotland
reviews.text: LOVED this hotel. Fortunate to have one of the rooms facing the golf course and sea. My room was newly updated and extremely comfortable. Loved the balcony and the windows that opened and allowed for fresh air. Loved the radiant heated floors in the bathroom. Both the room and the bathroom were quite spacious. Loved the charm and beauty of Turberry. Would definitely return.

reviews.title: spa day 29th July 2012
reviews.text: we arived at the spa reception for our spa day the receptionist was smilling and helpful we had a cup of tea as we were early.We had our treatments a facial and a back neck and shoulder massage which was excellent lovely and relaxing the therapists are very professional we had herbal tea in the relaxation area which was lovely nice and relaxed we sat by the pool until time for lunch in the grand tea lounge which overlooks the golfcourse we had a great view of the seniors open which was on the atmosphere was great.My friend and myself had a walk around the hotel and headed back to the spa for a dip in the pool and the sauna i would definately recommend a spa day at turnberry staff helpful and friendly .

reviews.title: Relax and enjoy the service and the view
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel - right on the water with a direct view of Ailsa Craig, a gorgeous golf course, fabulous breakfast (served in the grand dining roon), amazing service and very comfortable rooms. The spa is worth a trip for a massage (reasonable pricing), the restaurant is dynamite - do not miss the afternoon tea if you have the time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the first moment we arrived, we felt welcomed and comfortable. When we arrived at Turnberry, we were escorted to the reception area by the gentleman in Highland garb. Rather than the typical hotel counter you generally see in reception areas, we were ushered into an office with a desk and two chairs. Nice touch. The reception person was the same one who then showed us to our room, pointed out where everything was in the hotel, where everything was in our room, etc. It was nice, like having our very own host who made sure we were cared for.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back
Very nice but not perfect
reviews.text: We stayed in the Norman suite, which is enormous. The living room has a wall of windows facing the ocean, with a beautiful view of the grounds, the golf courses, the beach, lighthouse, and the two nearby islands. The bedroom has a similar view, just smaller windows. Spacious closet and comfy bed, with bottled water on our nightstands each day. The bathroom was enormous and well laid out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tea time: we tried the hotel's afternoon tea, which is supposed to be award-winning. It was very good; the only thing that surprised me was that there wasn't a smidge of chocolate anywhere on the tray. Nevertheless, it didn't stop me from having tea several times during our stay.
reviews.title: Very nice but not quite perfect!

reviews.text: Indoor pool and spa: It felt WONDERFUL, especially after an unseasonably warm day. Pool area has glass walls and a lovely view of the outdoors, yet feels very private. Nice. The massage treatment rooms felt a little cramped, although the massage itself was very good. The rooms need some kind of soothing music - it seemed odd to have a massage without it, especially when there was so much attention to detail with everything else.
reviews.title: Great Old Lady

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet: very good, with a nice variety of items available. Also available were cooked items from the breakfast menu - also very good.
reviews.title: Nowhere near a 5 Star Hotel...

aka: Turnberry, a Luxury Collection Resort, Scotland Hotel Turnberry
description: Nestled within an 800 acre estate with views overlooking the rugged Ayrshire coastline, Turnberry Resort is an enchanting destination. Turnberry is the world’s original golf resort with over a century of hospitality and tradition. It is scene of some of the most memorable moments in Open history, the championship Ailsa course is a legend in the game. Complimented by The Turnberry Performance Academy, an outstanding teaching facility offering a holistic approach to the game of golf; Turnberry is one of the most magnificent destinations for golf breaks in Scotland.With a range of outstanding accommodation, championship golf, a relaxing ESPA spa, six restaurants & bars and thrilling outdoor pursuits at Turnberry Adventures, Turnberry boasts a myriad of activities for travelers, golfers and families. The resort enjoys a spectacular coastal setting with breathtaking views of the Isle of Arran, Ailsa Craig and the Irish Sea.
